content: this is a summary of a legal case involving two parties unfortunately the details of the case including the parties names and the nature of the dispute are not provided in the first instance court the plaintiff was responsible for paying the costs of the case however the court of appeal has made changes to the initial judgment the plaintiff is now responsible for 60 of the costs incurred by the defendant while the defendant is responsible for 40 of the costs incurred by the plaintiff additionally the defendant has been ordered to pay the plaintiff a total of 47887 eur in costs the case involves a real estate plot and the plaintiff and defendant are former spouses the division of the property is determined as 10 for the plaintiff and 90 for the defendant the court of appeal has made a judgment in favor of the defendant and the plaintiff is now awarded 20 of the property the court considered the contributions made by both parties during the construction of the house the court also mentioned the defendants greater contribution in terms of work and investment the court has dismissed some parts of the appeal and upheld the judgment of the first instance court the court has ordered the defendant to reimburse the plaintiff for the costs of the appeal proceedings the court has determined the share of the coowned property based on the assessment of the circumstances at the time of its creation the court of appeal has determined that the defendant is responsible for 80 of the contribution while the plaintiff is responsible for 20 the court has considered previous case law and the relevant provisions of the property code the court has made a decision to proceed with the division proceedings even though it goes against previous legal rulings the court has partially upheld the appeal made by the plaintiff and has ordered the payment of costs however the rest of the appeal has been dismissed and the original judgment remains unchanged the defendant has been ordered to pay 47887 eur in costs for the appeal proceedings the court has referred to previous cases for reference
